titles.title: Encouraging the elimination of harmful fishing subsidies that contribute to overcapacity in commercial fishing fleets worldwide and that lead to the overfishing of global fish stocks.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E600)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife, and Oceans.
Mrs. Christensen moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 94.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Star Print ordered on the concurrent resolution.

bill.summary: 6/5/2007--Passed House amended. Declares that the United States should continue to promote the elimination of harmful fishing subsidies that lead to overcapitalization, overfishing, and illegal, unregulated, and unreported fishing.
